availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Vaughn (Webster County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Blackwell Vaughn in Union County, Kentucky, on June 22, 1859. Father of Edmond Vaughn, Ibba Vaughn, Davis J. Vaughn, Elizabeth P. Vaughn, R. H. Vaughn, and James W. Vaughn. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Confirmed as a notary public in Webster County on February 5, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 95.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Webster County Marriages, Film #000562204.
KYR-0001-017-0062.
